name: digdugz
text: A comment left by digdugz was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Contrasoma, stanshall, Overmedicated, StoatLad, JTTuba, blastradius, Ariamaki, whoper, bug, Courtland, equinn2006, farqussus, unquotable, NDCaesar, MortisInvictus, anewcede, YossarianLives, PoodleLucy, Doc_Rostov)

name: connellingus
text: This was the opposite of hindsight.

name: gormster
text: That would be foresight.

name: spinynorman
text: He previsioned it.

name: digdugz
text: Shit.

name: beansdooma
text: what else would you expect from epic fail guy?

name: charchar
text: Realistic epicfail action.

name: tekende
text: And possibly Kung-Fu grip.

name: epoc_jones
text: and a cartoon tie-in.

name: anzio
text: NO, guaranteed Kung Fu grip.

name: luckypyjamas
text:
i like to think that was actually the spirit of little nephew speaking to him, with the voice of james earl jones (a la mufasa from the lion king)

that's what it made me think of anyways

name: scott_karana
text: A comment left by scott_karana was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, lamboyster, Jhunter, Fermatprime, MortisInvictus, atticusonline, Axhoola, wingspan, spicyponyhead)

name: luckypyjamas
text:
i have a signed photo of james earl jones framed and hanging in plain sight over my computer desk

i assumed there was only room for one baritone actor in hollywood films, as there's only room for one in my heart

name: captneko
text: Mufasa was James Earl Jones. Scar was Jeremy Irons.

name: luckypyjamas
text:
he's right

why are we fighting about this

name: rasalghul
text: Jermis Irony.  That is all.

name: atticusonline
text: This is wrong. You are wrong here.

name: aparrish
text: This is probably the wrongest comment on assetbar.  It is an assertion that is straight up false.

name: jonmw
text: It is hindsight that came way too early

name: greenkoolayd
text: hindsight=the opposite of accidentally sitting on your glasses

name: epicurus
text: The face of Lil' Newphew saying all the things that make Ray not understand him is the best. Also, I have jumped off a roof onto a trampoline before and I believe that means I will automatically be admitted to the officer corps if I should enlist (Canada).

name: jackparsons
text: A comment left by jackparsons was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Contrasoma, ocarinak, riotdejaneiro, Spoon, Jesler729, josher, aHatOfPig, Epicurus, ibetso, rumblefish, henrythecad)

name: godfatherofsouls
text: You guys make us have an army.

name: pogo
text: Oh, we are under attack in the USA. Let us call on our staunch ally with the world-famous tough army, CANADA!

name: epicurus
text: Canadian law requires that as a citizen I bring up our modest successes in WW2 when someone disparages our military.

name: pogo
text: WW2 is hella old school.  What has the Canadian military been up to lately?

name: godfatherofsouls
text: lately they had some planes shot down by US pilots on speed they were helping and been wearing forest colours in the desert how bout u

name: saint
text:
I think I understood that.

Us shooting your plains down was just a practical joke.
Ha ha, Canada.

ha ha

name: woodenteeth
text: They've been up to Not Invading Countries for Oil Related Strategies.

name: invidious
text: Not getting asses kicked in southeast Asian jungles.

name: achtung
text: lost at home not militarily, casualty ratio, yada ya nobody cares

name: scifigrl47
text: You fool! You fell victim to one of the classic blunders - The most famous of which is "never get involved in a land war in Asia" - but only slightly less well-known is this: "Never go against a Sicilian when death is on the line"!

name: godfatherofsouls
text: yeah people hated em cause they used rifles at close range and just rushed at people with bayonets and gunfire like apocalyptic hockey players.

name: epicurus
text:
Awesome. Also I think some Canuck general was the first to successfully employ the concept of rolling artillery strikes?

Aside: "Apocalyptic Hockey Players" would be a sweet band.

name: godfatherofsouls
text: The Ahockeylypse

name: scott_karana
text: Canada's put more troops in Iraq than your precious ally of the time, Britain. 30,000 men is nothing to sneeze at.

name: boredom_man
text: Were they all Jeremy Irons?

name: wingspan
text: No, retard, they were James Earl Jones.

name: invidious
text: They were all Rick Moranis.

name: godfatherofsouls
text: And Dave Thomas, for the heavy jobs.

name: puguglypress
text: all pissing strange brew out of their dicks at bin laden

name: terribleman
text: You threw them out with the trash!

name: soticoto
text: ... That isn't a good thing... for Canada.

name: tonyhighwind
text:
In the sense that we make you nervous, or in the sense that we apply political pressure?

Because if we make you nervous you should remember that we're completely stepping on the face of the first motherfuckers who even try to steal your toques.

name: apocowarg
text: I used to live with a guy who tried to join the Army but was rejected after failing a psyche test. He used to "train" by putting small logs on the deck then jumping barefoot from one to another as they rolled. Cut his feet up pretty bad. I think he and Mike Stonetower would get along.

name: soticoto
text: I've jumped off the roof onto the grass (the garden) before. What does that qualify me for?

name: epicurus
text: Throw in some pushups with your feet and hands on treestumps and you're looking at Admiral.

name: soticoto
text: Can't I just jump off something else?

name: semiquaver
text: If you jump from lies to conclusions, you can be President.

name: spinynorman
text: Clever stuff.

name: soticoto
text:
We have Prime Ministers here.
Basically the same deal though.

name: semiquaver
text: Did not check your loc.  Plus you would have to be here to get the full effect.  Still, how is it having a Scot for your head government person?  I am a regular viewer of mock the week and similar panel shows but they do not stay current for very long.

name: soticoto
text:
I don't really care who is in charge here. We all get fvcked over anyway, so why bother arguing over who gets to do it?

I heard it is the same in america.

name: semiquaver
text:
No. In theory, if we work really hard, we can Change things. Some people do but it would require not being lazy and having scads of money so I don't and neither do most.

The election stuff is getting really exciting right now though...

name: soticoto
text:
You forgot the luck.
Never forget the luck.

In theory... if we work really hard... we CAN change things. Problem is, the people who believe that focus too often on those few who work hard and do change things rather than the many who work hard and achieve nothing.
The odds are not in our favour.

When one-on-one fighting against the world, sword-on-sword... just remember that your longsword does 1D8 damage whereas the world's sword, thanks to size modifiers, does 1D800 damage. The odds of you out-damaging it are small. Very small.

name: epicurus
text:
Dood buy a greatsword w/flaming/shocking and max ur strength or dual wield bastard swords w/flaming/shocking.

Whoah... I think my virginity just.... grew back?

name: semiquaver
text: Giggle.

name: mugi
text: Seeing the word "giggle" emanating from Stephen Colbert has been the highlight of my day.

name: semiquaver
text: You're welcome.

name: soticoto
text:
(1D10 1D6f 1D6s) x2
... 4 Strength bonus...

....... Minus the enormous penalty for dual-wielding oversized weapons.

Still isn't enough.

name: dapooka
text:
Someone's father should have called Mike Stonetower about 10 years ago, from the looks of things.

Of course the fact that I'm getting these references doesn't speak too highly of me in this regard.

Perhaps our fathers are more like Ray than we can envision.

name: soticoto
text: My father is more like Leo Fontanette : Dead.

name: lizjones
text: Crisis averted thanks to forethought.

name: agika
text: Wow.  Ray's imagination was all over that one.  Nice job, imaginary Little Nephew.

name: cousinted
text: Or maybe Little Nephew's developed telekinesis.

name: dak
text: Telepathy?

name: cousinted
text:
No, telekinesis. LN made a tiny, robotic version of his head and upper torso and is using his psychic powers to make it float in the air behind Ray.

It is a brilliant plan.

name: dovey
text: Nice save.

name: riazm
text: A comment left by riazm was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, Jesler729, bug, enginexsummer)

name: tekende
text: Except cooking, cleaning, and raising children.

name: terribleman
text: Maybe sitting on the occational cheese...

name: juancarlos
text: Lesse if  I remember the alt text: Mike Stone trained himself to be a marine the only way he knew, by jumping off the roof.

name: jackparsons
text:
Mike Stonetower trained for the Fake Marines the only way he knew how. By jumping around in his yard.

Fake Marines - and he got the buzzcut too.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Is that a real phone number on that flyer? Has anyone called it? I'm a little scared to try.

name: bookofsand
text: I dunno, but he got the area code for Debord, Kentucky right. I had a roommate from around there. Lots of roof jumping in those parts. Even more drunken swimming tragedies in the abandoned quarry.

name: tombsgrave
text: Ray is wise.

name: cdl146
text: Figures this sort of thing would be in Kentucky.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: The chicken pox vaccine really is the defining generational divide of our times.

name: heavymetaljesus
text: Man, that was totally Mr. Japan at work right there.

name: johnmatrix
text: Japan Man. Scalawag.

name: taidje_khan
text: Everyone knows a Mike Stonetower or two.

name: wae
text: That's how I taught myself to be a firefighter and an anesthesiologist.

name: ford
text: pissing on bonfires and playing hypodermic darts with the neighbor's dog?

name: hyetal
text: No, by jumping around in his yard, of course.

name: baryonyx
text: To self-train to be a firefighter you would just go into buildings scheduled for demolition and just get furious on all the doors with an axe.

name: tekende
text: Maybe bring a garden hose too

name: wingspan
text: Or a Super Soaker that you just pumped the hell out of.

name: tbtabby
text: It might not get him into the Marines, but I bet Mike Stonetower could get on Ninja Warrior. He'd never make it past the First Stage, though.

name: falseprophet
text: I love how Ray knows about MySpace, Flickr, and YouTube but has to create a portmanteau video game system. And then he just tosses in "IP telephony" and a medical conjecture.

name: dumase
text:
I love this one because you could think at first "Huh. Ray is probing into his own thought process and its validity in this case, ultimately concluding that he is not in a position to make such a decision."

When it's more likely that Ray is realizing that he does not want to get showed up by lil nephew.

name: corpsey
text: There's nothing that wrong with being a little chunkity, or a nerd but both... that just ain't good.

name: wfl
text:
But wait.. what about the chunkity ass-nerd ?

Sorry, just had an XKCD moment there :)

name: epoc_jones
text:
i see what you did there...

[[xkcdap]]

name: terribleman
text: Chubbied for avatar synergy.

name: hendetta
text: I know so many members of Fake Marines.

name: epoc_jones
text: SUFFER HAI

name: tekende
text: Do people really not get chicken pox anymore? I think Ray's Little Nephew spirit is making that up.

name: greenkoolayd
text: that dude disaprages women, but if he ever tried to pass a grapefruit thru his urethra, hed see how un-cheese-y women really are.

name: greenkoolayd
text: ray is worried about LNs waistline?  what about his own?  being a chunkity-ass is no better than being a chunkity-ass nerd.

name: terribleman
text: Little Nephew appears in a cloud of smoke to tell Ray that military school instructors must be assumed to have taken some nasty cranials.
